body_html:
PR: #12782

Here you go. It is nothing big, just deleted the occurrences of "contrib.tensorboard" and put a few checks in keras/callbacks.py.

I have looked for all of the instances of tensorboard with grep -rwn "tensorboard" and so far I think I have covered everywhere (grep has a recursion limit however I think I didn't hit it).

Maybe you guys have a reason to keep a part of the tensorboard inside contrib but this seemed more logical.

PR: #12782
Here you go. It is nothing big, just deleted the occurrences of "contrib.tensorboard" and put a few checks in keras/callbacks.py.
I have looked for all of the instances of tensorboard with grep -rwn "tensorboard" and so far I think I have covered everywhere (grep has a recursion limit however I think I didn't hit it).
Maybe you guys have a reason to keep a part of the tensorboard inside contrib but this seemed more logical.
body:
PR: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/12782

Here you go. It is nothing big, just deleted the occurrences of "contrib.tensorboard" and put a few checks in keras/callbacks.py. 

I have looked for all of the instances of tensorboard with `grep -rwn "tensorboard"` and so far I think I have covered everywhere (grep has a recursion limit however I think I didn't hit it).

Maybe you guys have a reason to keep a part of the tensorboard inside contrib but this seemed more logical.
